Interface_name: Http client-side based on Java.io & HttpURLConnection
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a REST client using HttpURLConnection for making HTTP requests with support for authentication, headers, and parameters.

Class Description: The RestClient class provides functionality to send HTTP requests to a specified server with configurable protocol, host, port, and authentication. It supports various HTTP methods, request parameters, headers, and handles response processing.

Attributes:
- protocol: [Protocol] - The protocol to use (HTTP/HTTPS)
- host: [String] - The hostname or IP address of the server
- port: [int] - The port number of the server
- username: [String] - The username for basic authentication (nullable)
- password: [String] - The password for basic authentication (nullable)

Methods:
- getUrl: [String path, Param... param] -> [URL] - Constructs a complete URL from path and parameters
- send: [Method method, String path, Option[] options, StreamConsumer outStreamConsumer] -> [CompletableFuture<Response>] - Sends an HTTP request asynchronously and returns a future containing the response
- tryGetResponseTextFrom: [HttpURLConnection conn, int status] -> [String] - Reads the response text from the connection
- getResponseCodeFrom: [HttpURLConnection conn] -> [int] - Gets the response code from the connection, handling 404 specifically

Helper Interfaces/Classes:
- StreamConsumer: Functional interface for writing to output streams
- SingletonIterator: Utility iterator for single-element collections
- Response: Contains status code, response text, and headers (implied but not shown in code)
- RestException: Custom exception for REST-related errors (implied but not shown in code)
